title: Live updates: Yankees jump in front thanks to Guardians error
description: Brayan Rocchio dropped a pop-up in the first inning of ALCS Game 2, allowing a run, and New York added two more runs in the second to chase Tanner Bibee.
author: Yahoo Sports
excerpt: With a win, the Yankees can take a commanding lead to Cleveland for Game 3.
text: The New York Yankees sprinted out to a 1-0 lead in the ALCS with a 5-2 Game 1 win in the Bronx, powered by homers from Giancarlo Stanton and Juan Soto and a stellar outing from Carlos Rodón.New York is looking to get a tighter grip on the series in Game 2 on Tuesday at Yankee Stadium, with ace Gerrit Cole on the mound. Cole started twice in the ALDS against the Royals — with the Yankees winning both games — and entered Game 2 of the American League Championship Series at 1-0 this postseason, with a 3.00 ERA in 12 innings pitched with eight strikeouts and two walks.Cleveland countered with Tanner Bibee. He logged 8 2/3 innings in two prior starts in these playoffs — both Guardians wins over the Tigers in their ALDS — and struck out nine while walking three. Brayan Rocchio had two of Cleveland's six hits in Game 1, including a solo home run in the sixth inning, but he'll need more help from the middle of the Cleveland lineup. html:
The New York Yankees sprinted out to a 1-0 lead in the ALCS with a 5-2 Game 1 win in the Bronx, powered by homers from Giancarlo Stanton and Juan Soto and a stellar outing from Carlos Rodón.

New York is looking to get a tighter grip on the series in Game 2 on Tuesday at Yankee Stadium, with ace Gerrit Cole on the mound. Cole started twice in the ALDS against the Royals — with the Yankees winning both games — and entered Game 2 of the American League Championship Series at 1-0 this postseason, with a 3.00 ERA in 12 innings pitched with eight strikeouts and two walks.

Cleveland countered with Tanner Bibee. He logged 8 2/3 innings in two prior starts in these playoffs — both Guardians wins over the Tigers in their ALDS — and struck out nine while walking three. Brayan Rocchio had two of Cleveland's six hits in Game 1, including a solo home run in the sixth inning, but he'll need more help from the middle of the Cleveland lineup. José Ramírez, Lane Thomas and Josh Naylor — Cleveland's 3-4-5 hitters — combined to go 0-for-11 with a walk and five strikeouts in Game 1.

How to watch Guardians at Yankees ALCS Game 2 (NYY leads 1-0)

  • Time: 7:38 p.m. ET

  • Location: Yankee Stadium | Bronx, NY

  • TV channel: TBS/truTV

  • Streaming: Max, Fubo

Live15 updates

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:58 PM EDT

    Gerrit Cole gets out of bases-loaded jam

    The Guardians loaded the bases with one out in the fourth inning, prompting manager Stephen Vogt to send in pinch hitter David Fry in place of catcher Bo Naylor.

    Gerrit Cole induced a first-swing pop-up from Fry for the second out of the inning. He then struck out Brayan Rocchio looking on nine pitches to preserve the 3-0 Yankees lead. The Guardians have now pulled their starting pitcher and catcher from the game.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:47 PM EDT

    Guardians manager Stephen Vogt explains decision to pull Tanner Bibee

    Guardians manager Stephen Vogt gave an in-game interview to TBS and explained his decision to pull ace Tanner Bibee after Bibee had pitched just 1 1/3 innings. Vogt replaced Bibee with long reliever Cade Smith in the second inning with the bases loaded, Aaron Judge at the plate and the Yankees holding a 2-0 lead.

    "Tanner’s throwing the ball well, but they’re getting to him," Vogt said. "They’re getting traffic on. Just felt like it was time go get Cade and stop it. Hopefully we can get some offense going."

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:44 PM EDT

    Cade Smith pitches a 1-2-3 third inning, and the Yankees fail to plate a runner for the first time in Game 2. He struck out Anthony Volpe swinging to end the inning. The Yankees hold a 3-0 lead after three.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:44 PM EDT

    Lots of innings left for Guardians to cover

    Stephen Vogt’s decision to intentionally walk Juan Soto to load the bases for Aaron Judge with one out was a certainly bold one, but Cade Smith was able to come in and end the frame with only one run allowed — a decent outcome for Cleveland, all things considered.

    Still, the decision to pull the plug on starter Tanner Bibee after just four outs will have significant ramifications for the rest of this game. Yes, there's an off-day tomorrow, but there are a lot of innings left to cover, even for a fresh Guardians bullpen that didn’t deploy any of its top arms in Game 1.

    And even if the relievers can keep this game close, a three-run deficit to Gerrit Cole isn’t an especially easy mountain to climb. We can debate the bullpen buttons Vogt is pressing all we want, but if Cleveland can’t score, those choices won’t matter much.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:39 PM EDT

    The Guardians put pressure on Gerrit Cole for the first time in the third inning but didn't plate a run. A Brayan Rocchio single and Steven Kwan walk put two men on with one out.

    Then Cole got Kyle Manzardo and Jose Ramirez out to end the inning unscathed. The Yankees hold a 3-0 lead heading into the bottom of the third inning.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:28 PM EDT

    Cade Smith limits damage; Yankees extend lead to 3-0

    Cade Smith got the job done after taking the mound with the bases loaded and Aaron Judge at the plate with one out. Judge hit a deep fly ball for a sacrifice fly that extended New York's lead to 3-0. Smith then struck out Austin Wells to end the inning.

    The Yankees hold a 3-0 lead through two innings. The Guardians find themselves in an unplanned bullpen game after pulling ace Tanner Bibee in the second inning. A bold decision from manager Stephen Vogt.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:25 PM EDT

    Tanner Bibee doesn't make it out of 2nd inning

    The Yankees peppered Tanner Bibee, and his night is done after he recorded four outs. After allowing one run in the first inning, Bibee allowed three straight hits, including an RBI double from Alex Verdugo, to start the second.

    Bibee got Gleyber Torres to pop out for the first out of the inning. But the Guardians intentionally walked Juan Soto to load the bases and pulled Bibee in favor of reliever Cade Smith with Aaron Judge at the plate.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:14 PM EDT

    Josh Naylor logged the first Guardians hit of the night with a leadoff single off of Gerrit Cole in the second inning. But Cole recorded three quick outs, including a strikeout of Will Brennan, to get out of the inning unscathed. Yankees hold a 1-0 lead heading to the bottom of the second.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 8:04 PM EDT

    Guardians limit damage to 1 Yankees run in first

    The Yankees had runners on first and second and a run on the board before the Guardians recorded their first out of the game. But Tanner Bibee got out of the jam with strikeouts of Austin Wells and Jazz Chisholm Jr. and a nice play in foul territory by right fielder Will Brennan on a Giancarlo Stanton fly ball to limit the damage to one run.

    Yankees lead 1-0 after one inning.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 7:56 PM EDT

    Costly error gets Yankees on the board early

    The Yankees are on board thanks to a very unfortunate infield error. Gleyber Torres doubled and Juan Soto singled to lead off the bottom of the first with runners on the corners and no outs. Cleveland then appeared to have its first out in the bag on an Aaron Judge infield pop-up.

    But shortstop Brayan Rocchio misplayed the ball and watched it bounce off his glove onto the turf. The error allowed Judge to reach safely and Torres to score from third.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 7:46 PM EDT

    Gerrit Cole's off to a strong start. A 1-2-3 inning with a strikeout of Kyle Manzardo retires the top of the Guardians order.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 7:40 PM EDT

    We're moments away from first pitch. Gerrit Cole is warming up on the mound for the Yankees.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 7:07 PM EDT

    Guardians drop injured P Alex Cobb from postseason roster

    It's not relevant to Game 2, but the Guardians have dropped starting pitcher Alex Cobb from their postseason roster because of a back strain. He'll be replaced by Ben Lively, who posted a 13-10 record in the regular season with a 3.81 ERA and 1.245 WHIP in 29 starts.

    Cobb, 37, was limited by injury to three appearances in the regular season. He made two postseason starts but lasted just 2 2/3 innings in Monday's Game 1 loss to the Yankees before leaving the game due to hip tightness and a back spasm. Now his season is done.

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 6:36 PM EDT

    Gerrit Cole to start for Yankees

    Six-time All-Star and reigning AL Cy Young Award winner Gerrit Cole will start for the Yankees. Cole posted a 3.41 ERA and 1.126 WHIP with 99 strikeouts in 95 innings of a regular season that was limited by injury.

    Here's New York's starting lineup for Game 2:

  • Tue, October 15, 2024 at 6:33 PM EDT

    Tanner Bibee gets the start for Guardians

    Tanner Bibee will start on the mound for Cleveland in Game 2. He posted a 3.47 ERA and 1.117 WHIP with 187 strikeouts in 173 2/3 innings pitched in the regular season.

    Here's the full Guardians starting lineup:
